summary: "Heart of Darkness" is a short novel by Joseph Conrad about a sailor named Marlow. He tells the story of his journey up an African river to find a trader named Kurtz. The book shows how European colonial rule in Africa was wrong and explores the bad side of human nature. It suggests that there's not much difference between those who consider themselves civilized and the so-called savages. The story makes us think about imperialism and racism. It was first published in a magazine and later became very famous, even inspiring a movie.
title: Heart of Darkness
